creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
inscription: left, hand-applied jizuri: 自摺　昭和二年作　京都三條大橋 {Jizuri, Shōwa ninen saku, Kyōto Sanjō-ōhashi} | bottom, handwritten: Sanjo Bridge in Kyoto | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, red artist's seal A: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper
text: Two apprentice geisha (maiko), dressed in furisode (long-sleeved kimono) and raised wooden sandals (geta) are crossing over the Great Bridge of Sanjō.
title: The Great Bridge of Sanjō in Kyoto
